description:
<!--
>  Note: This function is restricted and only runs if you elevate permissions using the [wix-auth.elevate()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-auth/elevate) function.
-->

The `createPolicy()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly-created policy.

You can create up to 3 policies per event. If you try to create more than 3, you'll get the "Maximum number of policies for the event has been reached" error.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Create Policy
body: body: 'Tickets to this Event are issued on behalf of the Organiser and are subject to the following terms and conditions.',

"body": "Tickets to this Event are issued on behalf of the Organiser and are subject to the following terms and conditions.",

params.name: policyId

description:
<!--
> Note: This function is restricted and only runs if you elevate permissions using the [wix-auth.elevate()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-auth/elevate) function.
-->

The `deletePolicy()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified policy is deleted.

Deleted policies are not returned by the `getPolicy()` or `queryPolicies()` functions.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.
The `getPolicy()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a policy whose ID matches the given ID.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of policies, given the provided paging and filter.
description: The `queryPolicies()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of policies and returns a [PoliciesQueryBuilder](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-events-v2/policies/policiesquerybuilder) object.

The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-events-v2/policies/policiesquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `PoliciesQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `PoliciesQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter and control the results that `PoliciesQueryBuilder.find()` returns.
The query runs with the following `PoliciesQueryBuilder` defaults that you can override:
[`limit`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-events-v2/policies/policiesquerybuilder/limit): `50`
[`descending`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-events-v2/policies/policiesquerybuilder/descending): `_createdDate`

The functions that are chained to `queryPolicies()` are applied in the order they are called. For example, if you sort on the `_createdDate` property in ascending order and then on the id property in descending order, the results are sorted by the created date and then, if there are multiple results with the same date, the items are sorted by the id.

The table below shows which `PoliciesQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryPoliciesGuests()`. You can only use one filter function for each property. If a property is used in more than one filter, only the first filter will work.
|PROPERTY	|SUPPORTED FILTERS & SORTING

|`id`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`revision`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#gt),[`ge()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ge),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`createdDate`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#gt),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`updatedDate`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`lt()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#lt),[`le()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#le),[`gt()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#gt),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`name`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`body`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

|`eventId`|[`eq()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#eq),[`ne()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ne),[`in()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#in),[`exists()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#exists),[`ascending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#ascending),[`descending()`](wix-events-v2.Policies.PoliciesQueryBuilder#descending)|

params.name: options
params.doc: Options for Reorder Event Policies function.

docs.summary:
Changes policy order in an event dashboard and agreement checkbox on the checkout form.
For example, if we have 3 policies in the list, after using this function the 3rd policy will become the 1st, and other policies will move by 1 position. By default, the policies are arranged by the created date in descending order.
description:
>  **Note**: it is possible to use both `beforePolicyId` and `afterPolicyId` at the same time but only the last one defined will be executed.

<!--
>  Note: This function is restricted and only runs if you elevate permissions using the [wix-auth.elevate()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-auth/elevate) function.
-->

The `reorderEventPolicies()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly-reordered policy.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Reorder Policies
body: // define event ID and policies to reorder
/* Returns a promise that resolves to

"body": "

Tickets to this Event are issued on behalf of the Organiser and are subject to the following terms and conditions.

",

"body": "

Nobody will be allowed admission to the Event without a valid ticket or pass.

",

"body": "

All tickets or passes should be checked on purchase, as mistakes cannot always be rectified.

",

description:
<!--
> Note: This function is restricted and only runs if you elevate permissions using the [wix-auth.elevate()](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-auth/elevate) function.
-->

The `updatePolicy()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the newly-updated policy.

Each time the policy is updated, `revision` increments by 1. The existing `revision` must be included when updating the policy. This ensures you're working with the latest policy and prevents unintended overwrites.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Update Policy
body: // define policy ID and policy object to update

body: 'If the Event is rescheduled, changed, moved or cancelled the Organiser cannot be held responsible for any resulting costs you may incur for travel, accommodation and other related goods, services or compensation.',

"body": "If the Event is rescheduled, changed, moved or cancelled the Organiser cannot be held responsible for any resulting costs you may incur for travel, accommodation and other related goods, services or compensation.",

description: Physical address

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line (usually street and number) as free text

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: a break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.
You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load per page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load per page.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
members.doc:
Filter object in the following format:
`"filter" : { "fieldName1": "value1", "fieldName2":{"$operator":"value2"} }`.

**Example:**
`"filter" : { "id": "2224a9d1-79e6-4549-a5c5-bf7ce5aac1a5", "revision": {"$ne":"1"} }`

See [supported fields and operators](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/policy-v2/filter-and-sort) for more information.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`

**Example:**
`[{"fieldName":"createdDate","direction":"DESC"}]`

See [supported fields](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-events/policy-v2/filter-and-sort) for more information.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order (ASC/DESC). Defaults to ASC

members.name: policy
members.doc: Policy info.

members.name: policy
members.doc: Created policy.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: ID of the policy to delete.

members.name: derivedFromEventId
members.doc: Event ID. Indicates the original event which current event was derived from.

members.name: derivedFromInstanceId
members.doc: Instance ID. Indicates the original app instance which current event was derived from.

members.name: eventId
members.doc: Event ID.

members.name: location
members.doc: Event location.

members.name: scheduleConfig
members.doc: Event schedule configuration.

members.name: status
members.doc: Event status.

members.name: ticketDefinitions
members.doc:
Map of copied ticket definitions from original event.
Key represents ticket def id in the original event.
Value represents ticket def id in the newly created event.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc: Event created timestamp in ISO UTC format.

members.name: title
members.doc: Event title.

members.name: userId
members.doc: Event creator user ID.

members.name: policyId
members.doc: Policy ID.

members.name: policy
members.doc: The requested policy.

members.name: address
members.doc: Single line address representation.

members.name: coordinates
members.doc: Location map coordinates.

members.name: fullAddress
members.doc:
Full address derived from formatted single line `address`.
When `full_address` is used to create or update the event, deprecated `address` and `coordinates` are ignored.
If provided `full_address` has empty `formatted_address` or `coordinates`, it will be auto-completed using Atlas service.

Migration notes:
- `full_address.formatted_address` is equivalent to `address`.
- `full_address.geocode` is equivalent to `coordinates`.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: tbd
members.doc:
Defines event location as TBD (To Be Determined).
When event location is not yet defined, `name` is displayed instead of location address.
`coordinates`, `address`, `type` and `full_address` are not required when location is TBD.

members.name: type
members.doc: Location type.

members.name: lat
members.doc: Latitude.

members.name: lng
members.doc: Longitude.

members.name: endDate
members.doc: Event end timestamp.

members.name: showTimeZone
members.doc: Whether time zone is displayed in formatted schedule.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Event start timestamp.

members.name: timeZoneId
members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time when the policy was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Policy ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time of the policy's latest update in.

members.name: body
members.doc:
Policy body, usually containing various terms and conditions. Min: 1 character Max: 50000 characters. **Note**: You can format text using various HTML tags such as `

`, ``, `

    `, etc.

members.name: name

Policy name that is visible in the dashboard and checkout form.

Min: 1 character

Max: 40 characters

members.name: revision
members.doc: Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the policy is updated. The existing revision must be used when updating a policy to prevent conflicting changes. You'll get an error if you try to use the previous revision.

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options. See [API Query Langauge](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language) for more details.

members.name: metadata

members.name: scheduleTbd
members.doc:
Defines event as TBD (To Be Determined) schedule.
When event time is not yet defined, TBD message is displayed instead of event start and end times.
`startDate`, `endDate` and `timeZoneId` are not required when schedule is TBD.

members.doc: Event time zone ID in TZ database format, e.g., `EST`, `America/Los_Angeles`.
